metadata.title: CVE-2022-2625 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A vulnerability was found in PostgreSQL. This attack requires permission tocreate non-temporary objects in at least one schema, the ability to lure orwait for an administrator to create or update an affected extension in thatschema, and the ability to lure or wait for a victim to use the objecttargeted in CREATE OR REPLACE or CREATE IF NOT EXISTS. Given all threeprerequisites, this flaw allows an attacker to run arbitrary code as thevictim role, which may be a superuser.

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
